meanings.definition: A person or thing that schedules.
meanings.sent1: The schedular at the office creates the daily timetable.
meanings.sent2: The company's schedular ensures all appointments are organized.
meanings.sent3: The little robot acted as a schedular, reminding everyone of their tasks.
meanings.sent4: Her brain was like a busy schedular, juggling multiple plans at once.
meanings.sent5: The schedular, like a conductor, orchestrated the smooth flow of events.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a schedule.
meanings.sent1: The schedular document outlined the timeline for the project.
meanings.sent2: She followed the schedular instructions to complete the tasks on time.
meanings.sent3: The colorful schedular chart brightened up the dull office wall.
meanings.sent4: His life felt like a schedular puzzle, fitting pieces of time together.
meanings.sent5: The schedular reminder beeped, signaling the start of the meeting.

meanings.definition: To plan or arrange according to a schedule.
meanings.sent1: She will schedular the appointments for next week.
meanings.sent2: They need to schedular their study time effectively.
meanings.sent3: He decided to schedular his day down to the last minute.
meanings.sent4: The team will schedular the project tasks for better efficiency.
meanings.sent5: Schedularing the tasks in advance helped avoid last-minute rush.
